title: New Dev Team vs Old Dev Team
body:
Let us define this:

New Dev Team - Under Meddler.  Many older designers either quit or left. Now mostly a new team.
Old Dev Team - Under Morello.  Came from over a decade of experience in champion design even before they started RIOT.
-------------------

Old Dev Team - Said things like True Damage is a bad game mechanic due to driving an HP heavy meta, ADCs should be limited in both mobility and CC, and that overly complex itemization and champions looked flashy but were bad for game health.

New Dev Team - Threw all of that in the trash.

><

Old Dev Team - Used to be on the forums, every single day, discussing changes, reworks, and even designed a few champions WITH the playerbase, using Player creations for both skins and champion design.

New Dev Team - Screw you players, we will do what we want.  We know what is best. (I.E. Karma, Morde, Shaco, etc)

>< 

Old Dev Team - Had a rich, and ever expanding lore system, including a weekly 'news paper' to tell you about the goins on in Runeterra.

New Dev Team - That's stupid, people don't really care about the Lore, this is all about competition and tournaments. (Again, Recent example, Karma.)

-----------------

What we basically see is a newer Dev team, lacking the decade and a half of design experience, and wishing to 'Prove they know how this game can be improved.'  They no longer interact much with the playerbase, they make what ever changes they wish to see based on only Pro Player ideas, and somehow think that the E-Sports is what drives the economy of LoL.  They ditch the rest of the 95% of the playerbase (where ALL OF THE MONEY COMES FROM) in exchange for their adamant idea that E-Spots will be the future of RIOT.  Despite the fact that other games have vastly surpassed RIOT when it comes to E-Sports.  A Single Minded focus on the pro-player base, whereas the Old Dev Team had never HAD a pro player base, and thus based their decisions on everyone.

Want to know why your complaints are never fixed? Answer is here.

Attack speed on ghostblade was alot healthier and smoother form of damage than duskblade. brutalizer + old LW were WAY healthier for AD assassins because they did less damage to squishies in the mid game but did more damage to raw tanks and didnt fall off as hard as lethality does.

And most importantly of all:

old dev team - something is blatantly overperforming ? Address it ASAP. Remember "scarizarding" champions? Morello was not afraid to slam the nerf hammer.

new dev team - oh lets just let it be overpowered for ABOUT 5-6 months before we decide to nerf it. 5 damage off of Janna. .05 ratio off of kaisa. couple attack speed off of ardent censor.

You know its gotten bad when the live design team decides to scrap brutalizer , Old ghostblade , and Old LW. Only to replace it with lethality stacking cancer. Alot of people think crit is the worst designed stat but I actually think lethality is the worst designed stat not only in all of league but in all video games I've played thus far.

Its mind blowing how incompetent they must have been to introduce something that can cause AD casters to be so extremely overpowered in certain scenarios (early/mid game, vs squishies/lack of armor, when you are snowballing it becomes even more oppressive because you get more based on level). But then becomes absolute worthless trash in other scenarios: (late game when people have their armor per level, any armor stacking item, exponentially lower damage when enemy has armor). I play alot of zed and in the current state of the game at level 13 if I have 2 lethality items completed, I can instantly delete a squishy that has no armor with just W E Q swap auto. Never in the history of season 3-5 was that possible. But when it reaches late game, not only does damage to squishies go down awkwardly, but anyone who buys the slightest armor on top of it will just take extreme amounts of lower damage. In the level 13 scenario, a double Q can take half of a squishies hp, but at level 18 vs a tank or a squishy that built tabis + armor from GA + shields , those same double Qs wont even get the squishy below ~85% and wont even dent less than ~7% of the tanks HP.

Is there anyone who wants a powercurve like this? This is the reason why the live design team somehow managed to make it aids to play against lethality stackers while also making it aids to play AS lethality stackers. Who wins here? If they would just remove dusk, edge of night, and ghostblade to replace them with old LW, old GB , and brutalizer then I bet a large portion of problems surrounding these champs would go away. If they are worried about old LW and old GB being abused by ranged champions, they can simply make old LW only purchasable by melee and make it so old GB's attack speed only activates if you are melee.

What a time to be alive, when some of the best design decisions for the game currently , are simply reverts to older designs.

Incidentally they have given up on trying to explain WHY they will not do reverts such as this. It is the same as Atma's Impaler. The singular item would fix most AD Bruisers who are very weak right now... and they have made vastly more powerful items than it ever was. 

It seems that they merely have an inability to say "oh, we were wrong. Sorry."

> [{quoted}](name=remakoro,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=L7p7Gpwq,comment-id=000c00000000,timestamp=2018-04-11T18:02:40.245+0000)
>
> HOTS was stillborn... So i dont think its a good example.

No, it is a perfect example because the underlying mistake is something every game does when they are desperate to reverse a declining player base. MMOGs in general make the same mistake, not just MOBAs - they try to make the game more "accessible" and faster paced thinking they will widen thier potential playerbase. All they end up doing is alienating the existing players. They end up killing off their game quicker. 

The same flawed logic behind what appears to be happening to LoL has led to the death of everything from MMORPGs to MMOFPS to other MOBAs. 

In some cases, yes, the games are already in critical condition and think they have nothing to lose. But in some cases they are viable and profitable playerbases, they just choose to gamble that on trying to grow to be bigger. They end up losing who they have.

How you win customers is how you will keep them. 
Dance with the one that brought you. 

Strategy MOBA gamers are what have been the core of LoL's success. Don't drive them away by trying to become a fasted paced dumbed down action brawler. In the long run you will neither gain new players nor retain your existing ones.
